channel.title: The Next Generation
channel.description:
I was sitting in a class of year 11s (16-17 year olds) with my media teacher, and she pointed out to a boy who had a laptop on his lap that he should not be placing it there as it lessens sperm count. She stated that it increases the temperature of the area by a large degrees and that it is the reason behind the occurrence (which i already knew).
It was only then that i realised that the next generation of males will be infertile because of the silly things they do (drinking energy drinks and heating up that area). Currently it is already hard to conceive due to the consumption of unnatural foods and chemicals, more couples are heading toward IVF for help. If you consider this and then add the current problems of youth into the equation, it seems like we have little hope left for conceiving naturally in the future.
What are your thoughts on this?

@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Well, I knew about this but didn’t take it in account, either way though - it’s not a healthy solution but a good solution for teens to not get pregnant from males haha… -.-

item.title: The Next Generation
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:9, topic:510827”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=629075.msg4269579#msg4269579 date=1364420146]

I’ve got pretty strong swimmers so I’m sure my kids won’t be retarded that’s about all that matters to me (as much of a vagina as I sound)

Won’t these kids be around your kids though? I mean you cannot keep your kids locked up forever without letting them interact with anyone, aren’t they bound to meet these kids?

Yeah but by the time that comes around, 6/7/8 years time hopefully then they’ll have new technology or new chemicals to put in the drinks or foods etc.

That wouldn’t stop those who have already been affected by the previous chemicals, that may help the children of the current generation but we’ve nothing but IVF.

It doesn’t seem to have bothered me or my reproductive organs, I’ve had a few pregnancy scares and had to get an abortion with my ex so I’m guessing it depends on the person. I don’t pump my body full of toxins other than alcohol and I do take care of myself so idk if that changes it.
[/quote]

great job on killing that innocent baby[/quote]
Thanks bro

Read full topic
